channel.title: phd-thesis on Sam Abbott
channel.description: Recent content in phd-thesis on Sam Abbott

item.title: Modelling BCG vaccination in the UK: What is the impact of changing policy? (PhD thesis)
item.description: Bacillus Calmette–Guérin (BCG) remains the only licensed vaccine against Tuberculosis (TB). In 2005, England changed from universal vaccination of school-age children to targeted vaccination of high-risk neonates. Little work has been done to assess the impact of this policy change. This thesis evaluates the impact of this change.

item.title: PhD: Research Aims
item.description: Summary of the research aims for my PhD thesis

item.title: tbinenglanddataclean
item.description: R package containing the scripts required to clean data from the Enhanced Tuberculosis Surveillance system, and the Labour Force Survey, and to then calculate Tuberculosis incidence.
